(~55 kg)[3]Hair color(s)BlackHistoryBased onBlack pantherPantherswere black-furred junglewildcatssimilar tojaguars,leopards, andmountain lions.[3]
combat: Panthers would pounce on their prey after stalking them and would hold tightly with their jaws while raking with their claws.[3]
behavior: Panthers were nighttime hunters, relying on their strong sense of smell and alert senses. They were expert climbers and had superb balance.[3]
reputation: Panthers were a favored animal of the godTempus.Solonor Thelandirafavored great cats in general, as didThard Harr.[5]
history: NOT FOUND

description: Pegasi, at first glance, resembled merehorseswith large bird-like wings. Despite this, they had other avian features as well: their lower legs were feathered instead of furred and their manes and tails were also of feathers.[3][6]
abstract: 5eR5e4e3e2e1eVarious depictions of pegasi.Pegasus5e3e2e1e5th Edition Statistics[1]SizeLargeTypeCelestialAlignmentChaotic goodChallenge rating23rd Edition Statistics[2]SizeLargeTypeMagical beastAlignmentUsuallychaotic goodChallenge rating32nd Edition Statistics[3]SizeLargeAlignmentChaotic good1st Edition Statistics[4]SizeLargeAlignmentChaotic goodGeneral InformationPatron deityEachthighernMovementFlying[1][2][3]VisionDarkvision,low-light vision[2]Activity cycleDay[3]DietHerbivore[3]Average lifespan40 years[3]100 years(greater pegasus)[3]Homeland(s)Arborea,Prime Material plane[1]Language(s)Speaks:Pegasus[3][5]Understands:Celestial,Common,Elvish, andSylvanbut can't speak them[1]Favored climateSubtropical[3], temperate[2]Favored terrainForests[2]AppearanceAverage height6 ft  (1.8 m)[2]Average wingspan20 ft  (6.1 m)[2]Average weight1,500 lb  (680 kg)[2]Hair color(s)White[2]Feather color(s)White[2]HistoryFirst appearanceMonster Manual1steditionBased onPegasus(Greek)Apegasus(pl:pegasi[2]) was a noble, winged equine.[2]
personality: Being wild and shy magical creatures, pegasi were not easily tamed and ridden. A pegasus would serve as an aerial steed only to a good-natured humanoid. In any cases they will strongly be opposed to wear saddle. The most common way they were trained was after being raised from birth though sometimes a grown pegasus might be tamed, with a friendly attitude to the tamer, making a worthy steed indeed.[3]Once tamed, a pegasus formed a bond with their rider, obeying their commands. If the rider became evil after it tamed a pegasus, the pegasus rejected them.[3] A pegasus acting as a mount for aPaladin. Being goodly creatures, they would only serve good causes and riders, with an absolute faithfulness for life. But they would never join a neutral or evil character.[6]
combat: In combat, pegasi used their hooves and teeth as weapons. A common tactic was striking a target from above. The pegasus dove at a target from a height of up to 50 ft  (15 m) and delivered a devastating attack with their hooves. If facing an opponent larger then they were, pegasi lured them into a confining space, where the larger opponents size was at a disadvantage. This was a common pegasi tactic againstdragons. Pegasi preferred to avoid combat if they could, instead using their speed and agility to lead their opponent on a chase, tiring them out.[3] If the nest of a pegasi couple was attacked, one of them would defend the young while the other one attacked the invader, striking at them to get their attention. The goal was to enrage the opponent and lure them away from the nest. The pegasus lured them as far away from the nest as possible.[3]
society: Pegasi were social creatures, living in herds. Herds were sometimes led by a greater pegasus.[3]Many pegasi revered the godsEachthighernandLurue. OnEvermeet, their queen wasYathaghera.[7] While pegasi considered all evil creatures vile, they harboured a particular hate forgriffonsandhippogriffs.[3] Pegasi were used by theSeldarineas mounts.[1]
abilities: Pegasi had the innate ability to duplicate the effects ofdetect evilanddetect goodspells at will. This was used by the pegasus to detect thealignmentof a potential rider.[3]
history: The origins of the pegasi could be traced back to the plane ofArborea.[1][8]
uses: Pegasi eggs are incredibly valuable on the market. A single egg could fetch up to 3,000sp. Young pegasi were usually sold at a price of 5,000speach.[3] Pegasus' feathers were supremely soft and could make the softest downs. They also were a valuablealchemicalcommodity. Alchemical sublimate of pegasus feathers had medical airy properties, when mixed with certain types of ashes, they formed anelixir of heroism.[8]NOT FOUND

description: Pentadrones were shaped like a five-pointed clockwork starfish with one eye on each appendage, on top of five strong mechanical legs, and a tube protruding from the center of the star.[6]They were capable of performing five simultaneous tasks at a time.[1]
abstract: 5e2e1ePentadrone5e4e3e2e1e5th Edition Statistics[1]SizeLargeTypeConstructAlignmentLawful neutralChallenge rating24th Edition Statistics[2]SizeMediumOriginImmortalTypeAnimateKeyword(s)Modron3rd Edition Statistics[3]SizeMediumTypeOutsiderAlignmentAlwayslawful neutralChallenge rating42nd Edition Statistics[4]SizeMediumAlignmentLawful neutral1st Edition Statistics[5]SizeMediumAlignmentLawful neutralGeneral InformationPatron deityPrimus[1]VisionTruesight[1]Infravision,Ultravision[5]Activity cycleAny[4]Homeland(s)Mechanus[1]Language(s)Modron[1]Favored climateAny[3]Favored terrainAny land[3]HistoryFirst appearanceMonster Manual II1steditionPentadroneswere the most advanced type of basemodron.[1]
personality: Like all modrons, pentadrones had an absolute sense of hierarchy and order, and could not be persuaded to disobey their instructions or betray their purpose in any way.[1] It was possible, however, for a defective pentadrone to go rogue and start acting in its own interests or no longer in accordance with its instructions, sometimes even becoming violent. Such rogues were relentlessly hunted by other modrons, although, unlike their properly operating fellows, they could be reasoned with.[1]
combat: Instead of using weapons like other modrons, pentadrones favored unarmed combat. They were capable of performing five attacks at a time. They also possessed a breath weapon in the form of a paralyzing gas. If destroyed, a pentadrone disintegrated completely into dust and aquadronewas instantly upgraded into a pentadrone to fill its position.[1]
biology: In addition to theirtruesight,[1]pentadrones were capable of seeing theinfraredandultraviolet spectrumsout to 180 feet  (55 meters) and 200 yards  (180 meters), respectively.[5] Their bodies were capable of functioning in severe temperatures, ranging from 210℉(99℃) to −100℉(−73℃).[7]
society: Pentadrones could communicate with other pentadrones and withquadrones. They were also capable of communicating withdecatons, but were incapable of communicating directly with lesser modrons and could not comprehend any of the more advanced hierarch modrons, such asnonatons.[1] In modron society, pentadrones were responsible for law enforcement.[10]They were always created as the result of quadrones being upgraded to take the place of destroyed or further upgraded units.[1]
abilities: Like all modrons, pentadrones were immune to all effects and spells that influenced the mind, fear and attacks that rely on energy from either theNegativeorPositiveenergy planes. They also had a resistance to acid, cold and fire. Pentadrones were able to release a gas that paralyzed creatures in the immediate area, and they could use this gas tolevitate.[7]
history: Around−346 DRNetheresearchmageand explorer LadyPolariscame upon Mechanus and the modrons. Shesummonedseveral pentadrones into her treasure house, which were forced to act as unwitting guards until theFall of Netheril.[8]There was approximately five hundred thousand pentadrones in modron society.[9]

description: A peryton's feathered and winged body was about 7 feet (2 meters) long[3]and 5 feet (1.5 meters) tall[4]and was similar to that of a giant eagle[3][4]with dark green or gray-green feathers.[4][10]Its head, however, was covered in blue-black[4]or purple[3]hair and was roughly the shape of a deer's.[3][4]Its maw was full of jagged fangs, and its talons were as sharp as razors.[3][10]On the top of its head was a set of extremely sharp and strong antlers,[3]which were as hard as steel[7]and jet black in color.[4]A male had light blue chest feathers, while a female's were pale brown.[4]A peryton's eyes glowed or glittered and were an orange-red color.[4][10] Whatever fell magic created perytons granted them a deceptively strong hide that was nearly impervious to anything but magical weapons.[3][7][4][8] Perytons reportedly smelled like humans, although others said the smell was indescribable and immediately triggered a sense of dread.[4] Perhaps the strangest feature of a peryton was its shadow. The shadow did not usually resemble the shape of the beast; instead, it was said to appear as the outline of whatever creature whose heart the peryton last ate,[3]usually an adult human.[4]Other reports suggested that the peryton's shadow wasalwaysthat of a human, and a legend told that they had once been humans themselves, hence the human shadow.[10]There was some controversy as to when and what shadow would be cast by a peryton. Some argued that the only time a peryton cast its own shadow was immediately after killing a victim but before consuming it.[7]Others said that a peryton's shadow reverted to its own onlyaftereating a heart and for a brief period afterwards.[4]Some attributed this phenomenon specifically to the female. In any case, the matter of the peryton's shadow was a longstanding mystery by the 14th century.[10]
abstract: This is aGood Article! 5e3e2e1ePeryton5e4e3e2e1e5th Edition Statistics[1]SizeMediumTypeMonstrosityAlignmentChaotic evilChallenge rating24th Edition Statistics[2]SizeMediumOriginNaturalTypeBeastAlignmentChaotic evil3rd Edition Statistics[3]SizeMediumTypeMagical beastAlignmentAlwayschaotic evilChallenge rating52nd Edition Statistics[4]SizeMediumAlignmentChaotic evil1st Edition Statistics[5]SizeMediumAlignmentChaotic evilGeneral InformationVisionDarkvision[6]Low-light vision[6]Activity cycleDay[4]DietOmnivore[4]Language(s)Common(understood only)[3]Favored climateTemperate[3]Favored terrainForest, hills, mountains[3]AppearanceAverage height~5' (~1.5 m)[4]Average length~7' (~2 m)[3]Hair color(s)Blue-black[4]to purple[3]Feather color(s)Dark green[4]DistinctionsBody like a giant eagle[3]Head like a demonic stag[3]Casts a shadow not matching its form[3][7]HistoryFirst appearanceMonster Manual, 1sted.Based onPerytonPerytonswere twisted and depravedmagical creaturesthat appeared to be a cross between agiant eagleand a demonic-looking, fang-toothed stag. They were known and feared for tearing the beating hearts from their victims' chests.[3][7][4][8][9][10]
combat: The silhouette of a peryton swooping down. Perytons attacked by slashing with their horns, snapping with their ferocious jaws, or clawing with their deadly talons. They were adept at attacking with all three at once.[3]They were especially dangerous when making swooping attacks.[4] Ruthless, they tended to focus on attacking weakest foes first, making surprise flyby attacks from behind cover, and then darting off again. If drawn into melee combat, they hopped about on the ground, using their wings to stay about 5 feet (1.5 meters) off the ground.[3][8]Stronger perytons would sometimes carry smaller prey and drop them from great heights.[4]Whichever target was chosen, a peryton rarely changed to a new one until either the target or peryton were killed.[4] Whenever an opponent was helpless or unconscious—whether from crippling, paralysis,etc.—a peryton would attempt to rip the heart from the victim with its claws. It would immediately consume the organ.[3]
society: Perytons sometimes hunted in groups, but their chaotic natures made it difficult for them to cooperate. They often fought over prey, since they feared that someone else might have the chance to eat the perfect heart.[3] They usually nested in small groups of between two to eight perytons[4]or family groups of up to four.[10]Nests were usually made several miles from their nearest neighbor.[4]They were very careful about where they made their nests, choosing locales where they could avoid other winged creatures; even if they weren't a threat to them, the perytons didn't want the competition or interference. They sought an easy, clear path to their hunting grounds.[9]
history: Clearly magical beasts, perytons were widely viewed as having had a magical or otherwise unnatural creation. No one knew for sure how they'd come to be, but there many theories had been put forward.[10]Many scholars pointed to the facts that a peryton had the scent and shadow of a human and required a human heart to reproduce, and concluded that they had once been human, perhaps cursed or magically transformed millennia before.[8]Perytons were generally said to be the creation of one of the evil deities, but which one is forgotten.[7]It was known that theBeast Lordof the ruins ofDekanterpropagated perytons, but whether he first created them or only bred them was not clear.[22] An alternative and perhaps more sinister tale was put to paper by BrotherDelfofVerdusk, apparently relating an ancient legend. He told that perytons had once been theKhalaofImaskar, a human race of evilBane-worshipers. As punishment for their crimes, they were cursed by five gods of law.Lathander, god of the dawn, said "You have been swift as an eagle in your flight from justice, so I curse you each of you with the body of the eagle."Mystra, goddess of magic, said "Fierce as a wolf have you been in your persecution of the innocent, so I curse you with the teeth of the wolf."Torm, god of duty, said "Foolish as a stag in rut have you been as you shunned what is true and good, so I curse you all to bear the head and horns of the stag."Ilmater, god of suffering, said "You have tormented and torn heart and soul from your victims, so I curse you with unnatural appetites, so that you may only live and prosper after devouring the hearts of your prey." Finally,Mielikki, goddess of the forest, said "While you acted as beasts, your heart contained evil which only humans can know. I curse you to always cast the shadow of the humans you once were, to always remind you of your terrible deeds and of the souls that you have lost." Thus, they became the perytons. This tale was unsupported by fact, but it did explain all their unusual human traits. However, some, likeTalyssa Strongbow, considered it ironic that their curses, particularly that of Ilmater—who aimed to shield folk from suffering—only drove the peryton to further murder and savagery. This cast doubt on the tale, or on the wisdom of the gods.[10] In theYear of the Groaning Cart, 1267 DR, perytons, along withharpiesandmanticores, destroyed the city ofLisin theMoonsearegion in what was known as theFlying Plague.[23] Sometime around1372 DR, KingObould Many-Arrowsmade an arrangement with the perytons living in theSpine of the Worldto defend his eastern border. In exchange, he granted them prisoners for heart-harvesting. This allowed him to focus his attentions on theSilver Marches.[3] Around1374 DR, they were being stabled by theZhentarimas mounts within theTemple in the Sky.[24] Sometime following theSpellplague, while exploring theSavage Frontierfor his new tomeVolo's Guide to Monstersthe famedVolothamp Geddarmwas attacked by a peryton on a crag overlookingPhandalinand lost his left eyebrow in the process.[25]

description: The phase spider resembled agiant wolf spiderwith blue, gray, and white coloration. It had a relatively larger head than a natural spider, with eight silver-white eyes. Phase spiders were about 8 feet  (2.4 meters) long and weighed about 700 pounds  (320 kilograms).[3]
abstract: 5e4e3eVarious depictions of phase spiders.Phase Spider5e4e3e2e1e5th Edition Statistics[1]SizeLargeTypeMonstrosityAlignmentUnalignedChallenge rating34th Edition Statistics[2]SizeLargeOriginFeyTypeBeastKeyword(s)SpiderAlignmentUnaligned3rd Edition Statistics[3]SizeLargeTypeMagical beastAlignmentAlwaysneutralChallenge rating52nd Edition Statistics[4]SizeHugeAlignmentNeutral1st Edition Statistics[5]SizeLargeAlignmentNeutralGeneral InformationMovementClimbing[3]VisionDarkvision,[1][3]low-light vision[3]Homeland(s)Ethereal Planeand theMaterial PlaneIntelligenceSemi-[3]Favored climateWarm[3]Favored terrainHills[3]AppearanceAverage length8 ft  (2.4 m)Average weight700 lb  (320 kg)Skin color(s)Blue, gray, and whiteEye color(s)Silver-whiteHistoryFirst appearanceMonster Manual1steditionPhase spiderswere monstrous arachnid-kin that dwelt within theEthereal Plane. They made quick forays into the natural world to snatch an unlucky creature to feed upon. Those stolen by phase spiders were never seen again and were regarded as unsolved disappearances.[3]
combat: Phase spiders transported between theEthereal Planeand theMaterial Planefor the purpose of hunting. It looked for a likely spot in the Ethereal Plane, and then teleported (its form of teleportation was known as "phasing," hence the name) to the Material Plane, presumably ambushing travelers it expected to be there, biting and killing them, and then quickly retreating back to the Ethereal Plane.[3]
behavior: They could not speak. They were regarded asneutralin alignment.[3]
history: In theYear of Lightning Storms, 1374 DR, a small group ofdrowarachnomancerstook over one of ancientIllefarnruins, interestingly enough, located in the deep jungles ofSamarachof theChultan Peninsula. Even though their goal remained a mystery, they brought a pack of phase spiders with them and kept the deadly creatures in the top levels of the ruined structure.[7]

description: Phoenixes were enormous birds with brightly colored feathers ranging from orange to red and violet, and blue-violet beaks and claws.[6][7]Their talons had the consistency ofdiamonds.[7]Their eyes were a glowingrubycolor.[6]A phoenix's body was naturally bright and shed its own light.[2] Phoenix bodies were almost immaterial, composed of flame taken solid shape. For that reason, they were capable of passing through extremely narrow passages and of engulfing opponents within their fiery bodies.[2]
abstract: This is aGood Article! 5e3e2e1eVarious depictions of phoenixes.Phoenix(Phoenix Nobilus Conflagrata[1])5e4e3e2e1e5th Edition Statistics[2][3]SizeJuvenileLargeAdvancedGargantuanTypeElementalAlignmentNeutralChallenge ratingJuvenile5Advanced164th Edition Statistics[4]SizeHugeOriginElementalTypeBeastKeyword(s)FireAlignmentUnaligned3rd Edition Statistics[5]SizeLargeTypeMagical beastAlignmentAlwaysneutral goodChallenge rating242nd Edition Statistics[6]SizeLargeAlignmentNeutral good1st Edition Statistics[7]SizeMediumAlignmentNeutral goodGeneral Information[5][6][8]VisionDarkvision,[2]low-light vision,[5]Infravision,Ultravision[7]Activity cycleAnyDietOmnivoreHomeland(s)Elemental Plane of FireElysiumLanguage(s)Telepathy,Phoenix,Avian[6]Favored climateAnyFavored terrainAny landAppearance[5][6]Average length10‒15 ft (3‒4.6 m)Average wingspan40 ft  (12 m)Feather color(s)Violet, red, and orangeEye color(s)RubyHistoryFirst appearanceMonster Manual II1steditionBased onPhoenix(Classical Greek)Aphoenix, orphoenix nobilus conflagrata(sacred, or fiery phoenix)[1], was a powerfulelementalbird that embodied the wild and unpredictable nature offire.[2]
personality: Phoenixes were described by many sages as champions ofgood,[6]and by others as random agents of destruction.[2]Most accounts agreed that phoenixes were reclusive creatures that did not seek out contact or conflict with other creatures, but, if disturbed, provoked, or properly motivated, showed relentless fury and destructive power.[2][5][6] Phoenixes had a fierce hatred towardundeadand attacked them on sight.[4]
combat: In combat, phoenixes were fierce adversaries with no fear of a fight to the death, especially since their rebirth was assured.[5]Though their physical attacks were quite fast and powerful,[2]they often preferred to use their large array of innate magical effects.[6][7] Phoenixes were extremely effective at destroying buildings and structures.[2] If a phoenix was slain in combat, its body exploded in a violent detonation that destroyed the phoenix and most of its surroundings.[2]
abilities: The eyes of these creatures were capable of seeing intotal darkness[2]andlow-light conditions,[5]as well as theinfraredandultraviolet spectrums. With the latter two senses, they had a visual range of 120 feet  (37 meters) and 200 yards  (180 meters) respectively.[7][10][note 1]They were practically impossible to sneak up on or surprise.[7] Their bodies were capable of withstanding incredibly severe cold and heat.[7]
history: NOT FOUND
uses: NOT FOUNDPhoenixes were among the most sought-after creatures bysagesandalchemists. Virtually all parts of their bodies could be used as ingredients forpotionsor in magical research. A phoenix's feathers could be employed in the creation of astaff of healingand in powerfulpotions of healing. Other body parts, such as eyes, beaks, and talons, could also fetch high prices, but many cultures considered slaying a phoenix to be a bad omen.[6] Thefire wingsspellrequired an amulet in the shape of a phoenix as itsmaterial component.[11][12] A phoenix's feather, when used as an additional component of araise deadspell, granted additional powers to its magic. In addition to extending the time window since the creature's death during which the spell was effective, it was capable of extending the life of a creature that had died of old age by one year.[4] A potion called thephoenix extractwas rumored to have been concocted using phoenix blood. When imbibed, it granted the boon ofelemental shieldagainst flames.[13]

description: Piercers had two eyestalks that curled along their shells.[2][3]Their stony shells made them indistinguishable from stalactites,[4][6]unless one were to notice their eyestalks upon careful examination.[2][3]The majority of their internal organs were inside the shell, but its mouth and its mollusk foot were at the exposed base of the shell.[6] Piercers could be found in a wide range of sizes,[2][3][4]with the largest being about 6 feet (2 meters) in length[2][3][4]and 1 foot in width.[4]Such large specimens could weigh as much as 500 pounds.[4]
abstract: 2e1eVarious depictions of piercers.Piercer(Mollusca Megastromus Pilum[1])2e1e2nd Edition Statistics[2][3]SizeTiny to mediumAlignmentNeutral1st Edition Statistics[4]SizeSmall to mediumAlignmentNeutralGeneral InformationActivity cycleAny[2][3]DietCarnivore[2][3]Average lifespan4 years[2][3]Favored climateAny[2][3]Favored terrainUnderground[2][3][4]AppearanceAverage height1"[2][3]– 6"[2][3][4]Average lengthUp to 6 ft  (180 cm)[2][3][4]Average weightUp to 500 lb  (230 kg)[4]DistinctionsStalactite-shaped[2][3][4]HistoryFirst appearanceThe Strategic Review#3Apiercerwas amollusk[2][3][5]with a shell shaped like a stalactite.[2][3][5][6]
combat: NOT FOUND
abilities: A piercer's eyestalks could detect heat sources from a distance as far away as 120 feet (37 meters). They could also detect sounds[2][3]and subtle vibrations.[6] The soft mantle of a piercer provided little protection; however, it could secrete an acid that dissuaded most predators from trying to eat it.[2][3] Piercers were not sentient.[2][3][4]
behavior: An adventurer impaled by a large piercer. Piercers slowly climbed to cave ceilings using their muscular "foot" in a manner similar to common snails. They could hang upside-down from the ceiling indefinitely by this "sucker foot", waiting for prey.[5][6] Piercers were highly sensitive to sound and heat.[4][5]When they sensed motion below them, they would release themselves from the ceiling, plummeting to the ground. If they successfully impaled a victim, they would slowly consume it.[4][5][6]If unsuccessful, the piercer was often killed by the fall, cracked and smeared upon the cavern floor.[5]Some scholars claimed that a piercer could slither out of its shell while consuming its prey.[5]In any case, it was highly vulnerable while feeding.[6]After finishing its long meal, it would have to crawl on its long journey back to the ceiling again.[5][6]If the movement of potential prey stopped for long periods of time, the piercer might slowly adjust its position over the prey rather than waiting for the prey to move under it.[2][3]If one piercer managed to slay a victim, several other piercers would sometimes fall in an attempt to join in the feeding.[2][3]
history: NOT FOUND

description: Pit fiends were both majestic and horrifying, with a hulking 12‑foot-tall (3.7‑meter)humanoidform that weighed 800 pounds  (360 kilograms)[3][7]Their bodies were armored with scales and were quickly inflamed in response to their rage or excitement. A pair of massive, bat-like wings gave pit fiends a gargoylish appearance and they often wrapped their wings around their fearsome, red figures. Their huge fangs dripped with hissing, green venom and their prehensile tails could be cracked like whips.[3][8]
abstract: 5e4e3e2e1eVarious depictions of pit fiends.Pit Fiend5e4e3e2e1e5th Edition Statistics[1]SizeLargeTypeFiendTag(s)DevilAlignmentLawful evilChallenge rating204th Edition Statistics[2]SizeLargeOriginImmortalTypeHumanoidKeyword(s)DevilAlignmentEvil3rd Edition Statistics[3]SizeLargeTypeOutsiderSubtype(s)Baatezu,lawful,evilAlignmentAlwayslawful evilChallenge rating202nd Edition Statistics[4]SizeLargeAlignmentLawful evil1st Edition Statistics[5]SizeLargeAlignmentLawful evilGeneral InformationMovementFlying[3]VisionDarkvision[3]Homeland(s)The Nine Hells[3]Language(s)Celestial,Draconic,Infernal,[1]Supernal,[2]Telepathy[1]Appearance[3]Average height12 ft  (3.7 m)Average weight800 lb  (360 kg)HistoryFirst appearanceMonster Manual1steditionPit fiendswere the quintessential tyrants and overlords of thebaatezu, occupying the top ofHell's hierarchy. Having been cleansed within thePit of Flame, pit fiends achieved levels of wickedness beyond that of ordinarydevils, becoming beings of pure, unimaginable evil.[6]
personality: After rising from the Pit of Flame, pit fiends had obtained a perfect understanding of their nature as devils.[6]Their spirits had been completely purged of impurity, for they had willfully chosen to reject chaos in its entirety.[9]They were both self-entitled narcissists and tyrannical masterminds that schemed to bring their dark agendas to fruition and ruthlessly pursued their inscrutable desires.[1][6]Within the depths of their enigmatic minds was a vast, manipulative intelligence and a unique understanding of agony.[1][6][7]
combat: A pit fiend fighting off abalor. Pit fiends could surpass their already mountainous power by training, and those that chose to learn magic could be truly devastating forces of destruction. Not only did pit fiendmagesoften specialize inevocationmagic, but the only limit to their magical power and expertise was time, a particularly frightening notion given their immortality.[11]But while their monstrous forms and array of magical abilities made them formidable foes, the greatest weapon in the arsenal of a pit fiend was potentially their minds. Through ingenious planning, fearsome guile, and creative tactics, pit fiends could win battles even without their power and magic.[3][7] Pit fiends normally began battle by enveloping themselves in their auras and summoning other devils for assistance, often attempting to get them into flanking position. From there, they used their magical abilities to rain down hellish infernos upon enemy groups, striking fear into the hearts of their foes and magically restricting those without armor, especially in regards to irritating spellcasters.[2][3]They viciously destroyed those they saw as most weakened by their initial onslaught. In addition to their claws, they were known to arm themselves with jagged-toothed clubs,ancus-like weapons, and burning maces.[2][5] Their other strategies involved turning themselves invisible while savaging those most capable of perceiving them.[3]If put in a dangerous position, they would maneuver the battlefield as needed and would not hesitate to sacrifice devils weaker than themselves.[2][3]The only mental shortcoming of the pit fiends was their complete and utter hubris. Incapable of considering the possibility of failure, they often sought out the most powerful enemies first with dauntless intent to prove their indomitable greatness.[1][3]
society: Pit fiends formed the terrifying nobility of the Nine Hells and stood undisputed as the greatest of the non-unique baatezu. They were the elite overseers of practically all other devils, and experts in fostering terror in both mortals and devils.[2][7]The pit fiends had proven themselves to have the subtlety and brutality to eliminate pretenders to their thrones of purity.[9]Despite all this, the prestigious rank of pit fiend was still highly dangerous, as they had to navigate Hell's convoluted rules and treacherous political landscape while still contending with the heavy responsibilities that came with their station as the servants of Baator's true masters.[1][2] A pit fiend passing judgement. The only beings that all pit fiends were subservient to were the dukes, duchesses, andarchdevilsof Hell, fulfilling their wills and sometimes serving as  seneschals or counselors. Every pit fiend acted as a vassal for an archdevil and controlled a large domain within their lands, whether in the form of a fortress commander, city governor, or general of a legion.[2]As his personal servants,Asmodeuswas the only archdevil that possessed a retinue of over twelve pit fiends.[2][4]When within Baator, they were always in positions of power, commanding legions of lesser devils, judging mortals, and controlling territory, rarely found without an entourage of slaves and weaker devils nearby.[2][12] Even outside of Hell, the might of the baatezu followed the pit fiends, as they led dozens of devastating armies against thetanar'ri. The dread that their legions wrought on mortals was enough to make most flee for days on end to escape them on sight.[8]They were not above acts of corruption and had the authority to entice mortals with Faustian bargains,[1][12]but only the most powerful and promising of mortals were offered their greatest temptations.[10]Pit fiends were often too busy with their personal plots and numerous duties to be bothered with mortal adventurers, only intervening in affairs when their plans were seriously jeopardized or at the cusp of victory.[2]
abilities: Every part of a pit fiend could be used as a weapon: their fearsome claws, their powerful wings, constricting tails, and menacing maws.[8]The bite of a pit fiend was both venomous and infectious, inflicting a wicked disease known asdevil chillsand filling the victim with vile poisons. The combined effect drained the victim's vitality and strength, rendering them powerless against the brutality of the pit fiend.[7]As easily as they could envelop themselves in an aura of sheer terror, they could ignite their own bodies to burn anyone too close.[2]Their scale armor and regenerative abilities made them incredibly durable, and good-aligned spells and weapons, or silvered weapons were the most effective means of stopping their natural healing.[7] The magical abilities of the pit fiends were largely based around their ability to create and manipulate flames, often with truly devastating force.[1][3]Their magic also allowed them to paralyze powerful beings, turn themselvesinvisibleand use asymbol of painto cripple their enemies. They could easilygatein a few baatezu from all ranks, from the lowliest oflemuresto fellow pit fiends, although the more powerful the type of devil the fewer they could call.[3][8]The most dangerous of their magical powers however, was their ability to cast thewishspell. By some reports they could do this once every year,[8]while by others it was every 99 years, granted to a mortal by performing a terrible ritual.[10]
history: NOT FOUND

description: Pixies resembled tiny elves, with reports placing them variously at 2.5 feet  (0.76 meters)[7][6][4]to as little as 1 foot  (0.3 meters)[1]in height. Pixies had silvery, moth-like wings and preferred to wear brightly colored clothing.[6]
abstract: 5e4e3e2e1eVarious depictions of pixies.Pixie5e4e3e2e1e5th Edition Statistics[1]SizeTinyTypeFeyAlignmentNeutral goodChallenge rating1⁄44th Edition Statistics[2][3]SizeTinyOriginFeyTypeHumanoidAlignmentUnaligned3rd Edition Statistics[4]SizeSmallTypeFeyAlignmentAlwaysneutral goodChallenge rating42nd Edition Statistics[5][6]SizeSmallAlignmentNeutral1st Edition Statistics[7]SizeSmallAlignmentNeutralGeneral Information[1][4][7]Patron deityTitania[8]MovementFlying[4]VisionLow-light visionActivity cycleNight[6]DietHerbivore[6]Average lifespanAbout 300 years[6]Language(s)Common,SylvanFavored climateTemperate[6]Favored terrainForests[6]Appearance[1][4][7][6]Average height1‒2.5 ft (30‒76 cm)Average weight30 lb  (14 kg)HistoryFirst appearanceMonster Manual1steditionBased onPixie(Cornish)Pixieswere a race offeysprites.[7][6][4][1]
personality: Pixies were mischievous sprites that enjoyed playing pranks on people. Such pranks included leading travelers astray and tricking misers into parting with their wealth.[6]
combat: NOT FOUND
society: A pixie demonstrating her helpfulness. Pixie villages each had different clans or families in it; community loyalty was very important to pixies.[6] Although pixies carried no treasure with them, they were known to have tiny hoards in their homes in order to impress visitors.[6]
abilities: Pixies had a number of innate magical abilities, such as being naturally invisible. At will, they could replicate the spellspolymorph self,know alignment,dispel magic,dancing lights, andESP. Once per day, they could turn invisible for as long as they desired, causeconfusionat a touch, and create an illusion with both visual and audible components; this illusion would remain until dispelled. Some pixies could replicate the spellOtto's irresistible danceonce a day.[6] In combat, pixies wielded appropriately sized swords and bows. Their arrows were sometimes drugged with a potion that caused complete memory loss.[6]
history: Pixies were among the creatures believed to have been created by thefeycreator race.[18] Maerovyna, adruidofChaunteawho led theHarvest HouseinDaggerfordin the mid-to-late 14thcenturyDR, was served by two pixies, agrizzly bear, and aleopardwho were ready to defend her with their lives.[19]

description: A planetar usually appeared as a handsome, powerful, and muscularhumanoidcreature[3][6][7]with opalescent[2][6][7]emerald skin.[4][5][2][3]They had opalescent[6][7]white-feathered wings,[4][5][2][3]stood between about 8[4][5]and 9 feet[3](2.4 to 2.7 meters) tall, and weighed about 500 pounds (230 kilograms).[3]They were typically bald.[4][5][3][6][7] Not all planetars appeared like this, however. For example, theShards, the planetars in service toSelûnehad long, flowing blue hair and pearly white skin.[12][13][14][15]
abstract: This is aGood Article! 5e2e1eVarious depictions of planetars.Planetar5e3e2e1e5th Edition Statistics[2][1]SizeLargeTypeCelestialTag(s) (revised)AngelAlignmentLawful goodChallenge rating163rd Edition Statistics[3]SizeLargeTypeOutsiderSubtype(s)Angel,GoodAlignmentAlways good (any)Challenge rating162nd Edition Statistics[4][5]SizeLargeAlignmentAny good1st Edition Statistics[6][7]SizeLargeAlignmentGoodGeneral InformationMovementFlying[2][3][4][5]VisionDarkvision,[3]low-light vision,[3]truesight,[2]ultravision[7]Activity cycleAny[4][5]DietOmnivore[4][5]Homeland(s)Upper Planes[4][5][3][6][7][8]IntelligenceSupra-genius[3]Language(s)All,telepathy[2]AppearanceAverage height8′0″‒9′0″ (240‒274 cm)[4][5][3]Average weight500 lb  (230 kg)[3]Skin color(s)Opalescent[2][6][7]emerald[4][5][2][3]Feather color(s)Opalescent[6][7]or white[4][5][2][3]Eye color(s)Glowing blue[4][5][6][7]DistinctionsMuscular[3][6][7]HistoryFirst appearanceDragon#64Planetars(pronounced: /ˈplɑːnɛtɑːrz/PLAN-eh-tarz[4]) were an order ofangelsinhabiting theCelestial Planes.[3]Truly awesome beings, they were defenders of truth and avengers of the fallen righteous.[9]They were messengers of the gods[9]and mighty generals of celestial armies.[3]They were also known to help powerful mortals on missions of good, particularly those that involved battles with fiends.[3]Along withsolars, they were the most powerful of thecelestials, apart from thecelestial paragons.[6][7][10]
personality: A planetar slaying a fiend. All planetars were good. Their particular ethical bent depended on the deity that they served.[6][7] Planetars gave off a sense of strength and confidence.[4][5]They inspired goodness in others by the power of their deeds, not their words.[9] Planetars loved battlingfiends[2]and slew every truly evil creature set in their path.[3]
combat: Despite their vast array of magical powers, planetars were more likely to wade into melee with their powerful, two-handed[4][5]greatswords[2][3]orbastard swords[6][7][17]—especially with swords known ascelestial blades, which glowed with radiant light and were engraved with theholy symbolof the deity that the planetar served.[17]It was said that only a planetar could wield such a sword,[4][5][6][7]which damaged enemies with holy radiance.[2]
society: Planetars, who numbered more than a hundred,[6][7]were found on the slopes ofMount Celestia, on the pastoral fields ofBytopia, in the forests of theBeastlands,[18]and on otherUpper Planes.[3][8] As celestial stewards, planetars directly served the good deities.[4][5]One or a few served as the right hand of a minor deity, while larger numbers served the major deities.[6][7]They were only sent to other planes to aid the most powerful and faithful of their deities' servants.[4][5]Only the most perilous of missions were assigned to them, such as rescuing a mortal cleric from the grips of apit fiendor recovering a stolenartifactfrom the lair of anarcanaloth.[9]On such missions, they usually acted alone.[9] A planetar succeeding at a mission had a small chance of being promoted to the status of asolar.[9]
abilities: In addition to the magical powers common to all angels, planetars could pray for and castdivine magicalspells like the most powerful ofclerics.[4][5][3][6][7]Beyond this, they had innate access to a wide range of powerful magics, for which they did not need to pray. These included but were not limited to the ability torestorevictims from ailments andraise the dead.[4][5][2][3][6][7]They could create abarrier of magical blades,[4][5][2][3][6][7]trigger a massiveearthquake,[4][5][3][6][7]sendwaves of exhaustionover their enemies,[3]charm large groups of monsters at the same time,[3]call down acolumn of divine fire,[4][5][2][3][6][7]andstun with only a single word.[3]Several times per day they couldtransform themselves into nearly any creature or object.[4][5][3][6][7]They couldcommunedirectly with their deity.[4][5][2][6][7]Whenever they desired, they could create acontinual flameof light;[3][6][7]turn invisible;[2][3][6][7]smite fiends with a burst of holy power;[3]remove curses,[4][5][2][3][6][7]diseases,[2][3]andfear;[4][5][3][6][7]dispel magic;[4][5][3][6][7]and evenspeak with the dead.[4][5][3][6][7]Planetars hadcontrol over weather[4][5][2][6][7]and could call down rain to quench a thirsty field or aplague of locuststo punish the wicked.[4][5][2][6][7] A planetar in flight. They bore all of the immunities and resistances of other angels and were surrounded by the same protective aura of good.[3][6][7]Furthermore, they could only be permanently harmed by magically evil attacks;[4][5][3][6][7]they couldregeneratefrom any other injuries.[4][5][3][6][7] Planetars couldsee in the darkand inlow-light,[3][6][7]and they alwayssaw things as they truly were,[4][2][3][6][7]being able tosee invisibleand shapechanged creatures and objects,[4][2][3][6][7]hiddentraps,[3][6][7]and evil auras.[2][3][6][7]They could even into theultraviolet spectrumto a visual range of 200 yards  (180 meters).[16]They could always sense when someone was lying.[2][3][6][7] The great wings of planetars allowed them to fly at great speeds with excellent maneuverability in the air.[4][5][2][3] Planetars, like all other angels, could usemagic to speak any language.[3][6][7]They could also communicate telepathically within 100 feet (30 meters).[4][5][2][6][7] As with otheraasimon, planetars could not be permanently slain unless on their homeplane. If their bodies were destroyed anywhere else, their life forces would return to their home plane, where their bodies would reform over a period of 40 years.[4][5][6][7]
history: NOT FOUND

description: Plesiosauruses had compact bodies and strong flippers that were used to swim. They had long and flexible necks that accounted for about a third of their length.[1]

combat: NOT FOUND
behavior: Plesiosauruses were aggressive predators. They attacked any creature that crossed their path.[1]They were also highly curious and considered to be one of the smartest species of dinosaurs.[2]
history: NOT FOUND

description: NOT FOUND
abstract: Venomous Snake(Poisonous Snake)5e2e1e5th Edition Statistics[2][1]SizeTinySize (revised)TinyTypeBeastType (revised)BeastAlignmentUnalignedAlignment (revised)UnalignedChallenge rating1⁄8Challenge rating (revised)1⁄82nd Edition Statistics[3][4]SizeSmall to mediumAlignmentNeutral1st Edition Statistics[5]SizeSmallAlignmentNeutralGeneral Information[2][3]VisionBlindsight 10 ft  (3 m)Activity cycleDayDietCarnivoreIntelligenceAnimalFavored climateAnyFavored terrainLandAppearance[5][3][4][2]Average length2 ft  (0.61 m) to 6 ft  (1.8 m)HistoryFirst appearanceMonster Manual II1steditionBased onVenomous snakeVenomous snakes, often wrongly called poisonous snakes, weresnakesno more than 7 ft  (2.1 m) long with venom glands and hollow fangs who bit their prey, injecting various venoms into the preys bodies.[6][4]
combat: Venomous snakes could pose a danger in two different ways; The first was by having a strong venom that would induce sickness or even death in normal sized or larger targets. The other by slithering in swarms of up to 6 members and overwhelming their prey by the combined wight of their venomous bites. Of course the greatest danger was when they combined both and a swarm of snakes with deadly venom would work together to bring down even hardy foes.[5][3][4]
behavior: All types of venomous snakes were ambush predators and would conceal themselves in foliage or underneath rocks, waiting for prey to amble near whereupon they would strike out and bite, injecting their venom into the target.[3][4]
history: Various venomous snakes were all over the place, from theCalim DesertinCalimshan,[14]in the midwood of theCormanthorforest,[15]to theUmber MarshesnearThay.[16]

description: Polar bears had white coats and were long and lean. When standing, they stood taller thanbrown bears.[2]
abstract: 5e2ePolar Bear5e3e2e1e5th Edition Statistics[1]SizeLargeTypeBeastAlignmentUnalignedChallenge rating23rd Edition Statistics[2]SizeLargeTypeAnimalAlignmentAlwaysneutralChallenge rating42nd Edition Statistics[3]AlignmentNeutral1st Edition Statistics[4]SizeLargeAlignmentNeutralGeneral InformationMovementSwimming[2]VisionLow-light vision[2]Favored climateCold[2]Favored terrainPlains[2]AppearanceAverage heightGreater than 9'[2]HistoryFirst appearanceMonster Manual II1steditionBased onPolar bearPolar bearswere a type ofbearadapted to cold environs.[2]They were favored by the polar godUlutiu.[5]
combat: When a polar bear attacked, it primarily used its powerful claws, tearing at its prey, as well as its bite.[1]It would also pull its opponents into a grapple.[2]
behavior: A polar bear was a superb swimmer. Its white coat also gave it an advantage when hunting in snowy areas.[2]
reputation: Polar bears were important in the culture of theIulutiunsof the Great Glacier, where a child's first polar bear kill was celebrated with a ritual known as thenukiewquak, in which the bear's head was kept on a pole outside the family house for many days.[9]The first polar bear kill of the year was also celebrated.[17]Polar bears were associated with the virtue of courage within the Iulutiun culture.[17] Powerfuldruidsandrangerssometimes had polar bears as companions.[18]
history: The famous wise man of the Iulutiuns,Inum, had been crippled by a polar bear.[19]Heafstaag, king of theTribe of the ElkofIcewind Dalehad had his hand mauled by a polar bear.[20]
uses: Polar bear meat was barely edible to most people. It was tough and stringy and hard to digest.[8]The Iulutiuns ate polar bear meat[8][9]and used its fur for clothing.[10]Likewise,Nakulutiunsconsumed polar bear meat,[11]as did theIce Huntersof theSea of Moving Ice.[12]Among non-humans, theInnugaakalikuritwore polar bear fur as well.[13][14]White dragons[15]andtirichik[13]also preyed upon polar bears. Polar bear bone was carvable.[16]NOT FOUND

description: Horses were classified in a number of different manners.Chargers, or more plainlywarhorseswere those horses bred to ride in battle.[9]Light warhorses were referred to ascourserswhile heavy warhorses were known asdestriers.[10]

They were often used byhumanoidraces for riding, the pulling of carts and wagons or other forms of work.[6][7][8]
combat: NOT FOUND
behavior: Some of the best-trained horses were trained by theelvenHouse Korianthil.[11]
reputation: Horses were considered sacred to many faiths ofFaerûn. Warhorses were important to followers ofAnhur, theRed Knight, andTempus. Pinto and piebald horses were particularly favored byDeneir; palomino horses toWaukeen. Gray-haired horses were sacred toMask, while white ones were sacred toMilil, and chestnut-colored horses toSune.Mystrafavoreddonkeys, horses, andmuleswith blue or mismatched eyes. Intelligent horses were also native to the celestial realms ofSehanine Moonbow.[12] Horses were a kind of novelty forThymaridragonborn, as such beasts weren't common inAbeir. As such, horses, specially warhorses were highly valued by Thymari, who cared for them as precious friends.[13]
history: A white horse was the symbol for thesun elfhouse ofEvanara.[14] Horses were unknown inMazticaprior to the arrival of theGolden Legionin1361 DR. The Golden Legion used them in battle against the Mazticans, who were shocked by them and had no experience in fighting cavalry before.[15]

abstract: 5Re5e4e3e2e1eVarious depictions of clerics.Cleric(Priest)AbbreviationClr,[1]P[2]Class Statistics5e4e3e2e1e5th Edition Statistics[3][4][5][6][7][8]Base ClassDivine DomainsArcanaDeathForgeGraveKnowledgeLifeLightNatureOrderPeaceTempestTrickeryTwilightWarProficienciesWeaponsSimple weaponsArmorLight armorMedium armorShieldsMagic UseMagic typeDivineSpell preparationPreparedDivine focusHoly symbols4th Edition Statistics[9][10]Base ClassRoleLeaderPower sourceDivineParagon pathsAngelic avengerDivine oracleRadiant servantThay infiltratorWarpriestProficienciesWeaponsSimplemelee weaponsSimpleranged weaponsArmorCloth armorLeather armorHide armorChainmailImplementsHoly symbols3rd Edition Statistics[11]Base ClassProficienciesWeaponsSimple weaponsArmorLight armorMedium armorHeavy armorShieldsLanguagesCelestial,Abyssal,InfernalMagic UseMagic typeDivineSpell preparationPreparedDivine focusHoly symbols2nd Edition Statistics[12][13]Priest Class1st Edition Statistics[14][15]Base ClassSubclassesDruidShukenjaSoheiRequirementsAlignmentLGNGCGLNNCNLENECEList of known clericsList of cleric spells
combat: NOT FOUND
abilities: Clerics commonly usedlightormedium armor,shields, simple weapons, anddivine magicas their chief tools while adventuring.[28]Many clerics were also skilled in the use ofheavy armor.[31]Clerics augmented thesespells, also known as "prayers,"[23]throughholy symbolsof their deity that they wore or carried with them.[32]Clerics were also experts in castingrituals, enhanced spells that require an incredible amount of time and preparation to use but which often had dramatic effects.[32]Others might instead have chosen to be trained in preparingalchemicalrecipes.[33] Clerics could also learn to directly access the channel the divinity of their deity through their body.[34]This power manifested itself in several ways, the most common of which was the ability toturn undead, repelling or even destroying theundead.[34]A few clerics learned instead to control the undead, particularly those of an evil nature.[31]Some clerics may have learned to channel divinity based on theirdomain[32]or the nature of the deity they worshiped.[35]Clerics ofMielikkiandSune, for example, had access to wildly different ways to channel their deity's divinity.[36] Sufficiently experienced clerics could even invoke their deity's intervention directly, without using Channel Divinity. If successfully petitioned, the deity's aid could come in one of several forms, from a spell to something more unusual. Such calls for aid, however, were difficult to make and the gods were disinclined to respond much more often than once atenday.[37] Some clerics were powerful healers thanks to special training and the blessings of their gods, both of which increased the potency of the curative prayers available to them. Many clerics were capable of casting thehealing wordprayer, while more experienced clerics were often capable of much more.[38]Some clerics were also trained in transforming other prayers into powers of healing or, if the cleric worshiped a non-good god, into spells ofnecroticpower.[39] Some clerics had additional abilities less common among their compatriots. Several clerics learned, in addition to thegentle reposeritual known to many of them, the ritual ofSimbul's conversion, which allowed a cleric to convert their prayers into healing energy. A fewer number of clerics, generally evil in alignment, learned instead to convert this stored energy intonegative energyfor the purpose of harming enemies.[39] Many clerics were also fluent inSupernalorAbyssal, as well as their related dialects.[39]
history: NOT FOUND

description: Pseudodragons typically had bodies about 1 foot  (30 centimeters) long, with a 2‑foot-long (61‑centimeter) tail and weighed about 7 pounds  (3.2 kilograms). They hadchameleon-like abilities, though their color was usually a brownish red.[3]

combat: NOT FOUND
abilities: They could communicate telepathically inCommonorDraconicand also through the vocalization of animal noises. While pseudodragons could bite, their main weapon was a stinging, poisonous tail.[3]

description: At first glance, pterafolk in their natural forms looked like tail-lesslizardfolkorsaurials, but they were much taller and leaner and had elongated cranial crests likepteranodons. They had smooth, fine scales, much like those of a snake, that ranged in color from forest-green to light shades of tan. Their arms and legs were thin and long, and their hands and feet bore sharp claws.[5][6][3][8] Pterafolk did not wear clothing, except for belts andbandoliersfor carrying small items.[7]
abstract: 5e3e2eVarious depictions of pterafolk.Pterafolk(Pteradon[1])5e3e2e5th Edition Statistics[2]SizeLargeTypeMonstrosityAlignmentNeutral evilChallenge rating13rd Edition Statistics[3][4]SizeLargeTypeMonstrous humanoidSubtype(s)ShapechangerAlignmentUsuallyneutral evilChallenge rating32nd Edition Statistics[5][6]SizeLargeAlignmentNeutral evilGeneral Information[5]Patron deityShekinesterFormerly:TheWorld Serpent[7]MovementFlyingVisionDarkvision[4]Activity cycleDiurnalDietOmnivorousHomeland(s)Chultan Peninsula[8]IntelligenceAverageLanguage(s)Draconic,[3]Common[2]Favored terrainJungleAppearance[5][6][3]Average height10 ft  (3 m)Average wingspan15 ft  (4.6 m)Skin color(s)Olive-green to forest-green, tanTypical buildReptilian humanoidDistinctionsHead crest, beakHistoryFirst appearanceThe Ring of Winter[9]Pterafolk(pronounced: /ˈtɛərɛfoʊlk/TAIR-eh-folk[2]), also called "pteramen"[6]or "ptera-men",[5]were a race of shape-shiftingpteranodon-likehumanoidsnearly unique to the jungles ofChult.[8]
personality: While not all lizardfolk wereevil, it was generally agreed that pterafolk were cruel and vicious as a rule.[5][6]They were highly untrusting of anyone outside their own race.[10]They had an innate predilection towards violent behavior, but those raised in other societies sometimes had the capacity to overcome this tendency and take on alignments beyond evil.[7] Pterafolk liked to collect things valued by the communities near where they lived.[5]
combat: Pterafolk rarely strategized, but they had certain tactics they used regularly in combat. They used dive-bombing tactics, dropping from altitudes of 100 feet (30 meters) or more to swoop down on their foes and strike with their rear claws, toothed beak, or barbed spears. They preferred circling their opponents and diving upon them in turn such that there would be a constant stream of diving attacks from all directions.[5][6][3] Some clans cared little for training and relied only on instinct in battle. Others had a form of organized training that producedfighters,barbarians, orrangers.[7]If they wore armor or used weapons—often barbedspears[5][6][3]— they were custom-made to not interfere with flight.[7]
biology: A pterafolk takes flight. Pterafolk ate both meat and vegetables. Their favorite meats were frombrontotheresandhornless rhinoceros—massive prehistoric mammals still roaming in the jungles of Chult—andaxebeaks—mammoth flightless birds. They also consumed jungle fruits, roots, bark, and flowers.[5][9] Pterafolk mated for life.[5][9]Females laid eggs high on mountain peaks and both parents guarded the eggs.[10]When the young reached adulthood, they would leave the tribe and form smaller bands until they could establish territory or a tribe of their own.[5][9] It was exceptionally rare for a pterafolk individual to die of old age; death in battle was expected.[10]
society: Pterafolk were sometimes called the "Hidden Folk" along withophidians, because they were not well-known and preferred to stay that way.[11]While they were extremely rare outside theChultan Peninsula, in1372 DRthey made up 4% of the population ofChult.[12] Their culture was one where the strong trampled on the weak, and the needs of an individual outweighed the needs of the group.[8]Betrayal and infighting were common occurrences.[10] Pterafolk lived either in large tribes or in small bands of between ten and thirty individuals. The smaller groups were disorganized and generally controlled by which ever pterafolk individual was strongest or loudest.[5][6] Larger tribes had established communities with cultures similar to those of other races living around them.[5][6]Tribes were subdivided into clans of related individuals.[10]Strangely, these larger tribes were often ruled by a spirit naga, who functioned as chieftain with absolute power and responded to the tribe's requests and acted as a judge over their disputes.[10] Pterafolk lived in grass huts built high above the jungle canopy. Each hut housed one to four persons.[5][6] Pterafolk were enemies of theTabaxitribe ofhumansand theBatirigoblintribe.[5][6][3]Ironically, pterafolk were sometimes preyed upon by actual pteranodons.[5][9]
abilities: Batiriand pteramen attack jungle adventurers. Similar to how ayuan-ticould change its form at will into a snake, the pterafolk could "unfurl" a pair of eight-foot-long, leathery, webbed wings for flying or even take the form of a small pteranodon. They tended to only use such forms when they wanted to fly.[5][6][3]
history: Sages and scholars ofFaerûnbelieved that lizardfolk evolved from pterafolk. Rumors among adventurers claimed that pterafolk were the result of magical experiments on pteranodons.[5][6] In fact, neither tale was true; pterafolk were one of the many creations of thesarrukhofMhairshaulk[13]and were bred from lizardfolk.[8]The pterafolk gave the sarrukh armies more power, owing to their flight and viciousness, but they were also more difficult to control.[8] After the fall of Mhairshaulk, many of the sarrukh's enemies attempted to hunt down and destroy the pterafolk.[10] During theTime of Troublesin1358 DR, the godKossuthled a war against the pterafolk after appearing below thePeaks of Flameand choosing afirenewtnamedChassanas his avatar.[14] While they usually kept to themselves, in1363 DR,Kaverin Ebonhandhad managed to convince several dozen of them to fight with him in his assault on the holy city ofMezro. They dropped rocks and explosive items upon the city from the air. When Kaverin was slain by the famousHarperArtus Cimber, however, the pterafolk abandoned the fight.[5][9][3]
magic: Pterafolk distrustedmagic, so spellcasters were very rare among them, and they would usually destroy any magical items they found as spoils. If the tribe was overseen by aspirit naga, it might train up acolytes who could castdivine magic.[7]

description: A pteranodon was a birdlike reptile with sharp talons and leathery skin. One of the few flying dinosaur species, this monster was able to fly quite aptly due to its 30 ft. (9.1 m) leathery wings.[3]Combined with a long beak, the pteranodon held the middle ground between a reptile and a bird, although its beak was beset with razor-sharp teeth. It had a thin headcrest, and its skin contained small patches of downy feathers. Its large eyes were yellow-colored.[8]
